content.div:
Justin Bieber’s mom is writing a tell-all book about her troubled youth, and early struggle as a single parent.

Pattie Mallette’s memoir will chronicle her childhood of trauma, abuse and addiction, including a suicide attempt at 17. She will also write about her trials as a single mother before her son became an international pop star.

Nowhere But Up: The Story of Justin Bieber’s Mom will be written in collaboration with writer A.J. Gregory, and will include a forward by Bieber himself. It is scheduled for a Sept. 18 release.

In a press release, Mallette said she hopes her story will offer a positive message to teen girls and young women facing similar challenges.

“I want them to see that no matter how desperate their circumstances may be, they can have hope for a better future,” Mallette said.

"Pattie's story is a powerful example of courage and determination that will inspire anyone who has faced struggles in life," Jennifer Leep, editorial director for Revell, also said in the statement. "She's living proof that even in the darkest of places, there is always room for hope."

source.title: Justin Bieber's Mommy Writing Tell-All
source.subtitle: Justin Bieber's mom, Pattie Mallette, is writing a tell-all book about her troubled youth, and early struggle as a single parent.

link.title: Is Tim Tebow Praying For Romance with Taylor Swift?

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift and The Civil Wars debuted their Hunger Games music video "Safe & Sound." Check it out here, along with the movie soundtrack's full tracklisting, which features contributions from Arcade Fire and The Decemberists.

link.Abstract: How can you dump someone if nobody knows you're dating? Only Taylor Swift and Eddie Redmayne know the answer.

link.Abstract: Watch Taylor Swift's new video for "Ours," wherein everyone's favourite country-pop star plays an office drone. The work world, much like any Swift video, is a lot like high school.

link.Abstract: Rapper Drake will face off for album of the year against pop prince Justin Bieber, crooner Michael Buble, Nickelback and Avril Lavigne (Goodbye Lullaby). Drake is nominated for his critically acclaimed effort, Take Care.

link.Abstract: Selena Gomez appeared on the Ellen Degeneres Show. The talk show host talked to Gomez about "what a crazy last two weeks it's been in the news," but it's unclear whether Gomez was commenting on the Justin Bieber paternity suit, or the several other things she's been caught up in recently. For instance, a man accused of stalking the pop star was set free Wednesday.
link.title: Selena Gomez Talks Justin Bieber Paternity Suit (Or Maybe Her Alleged Stalker?)

link.title: Video: Selena Gomez Parties 'Til Dawn in 'Hit the Lights' (Is Somebody Celebrating Today's Bieber News?)
